item.name: Curcumin (from turmeric)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Riboflavin (Vitamin B2), formerly called lactoflavin
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Tartrazine (FD&C Yellow 5)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Quinoline Yellow WS
item.status: Approved in the EU. Undergoing a voluntary phase-out in the UK.[citation needed]

item.name: Sunset Yellow FCF (Orange Yellow S, FD&C Yellow 6)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Banned in Norway. Products in the EU require warnings and its use is being phased out.[citation needed] Approved in the US.

item.name: Cochineal, Carminic acid, Carmine (Natural Red 4)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Citrus Red 2
item.status: Approved in the United States only for use in colouring the skin of oranges.

item.name: Carmoisine (azorubine)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Undergoing a voluntary phase-out in the UK. Currently banned in Canada, Japan, Norway, USA .[citation needed] EU currently evaluating health risks.[citation needed]

item.name: Ponceau SX, Scarlet GN
item.status: Only permitted for externally applied drugs and cosmetics in the US.

item.name: Erythrosine (FD&C Red 3)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Allura Red AC (FD&C Red 40)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Banned in Switzerland[citation needed]. Undergoing a voluntary phase out in the UK. Approved in the US.

item.name: Indigo carmine (indigotine, FD&C Blue 2)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Brilliant Blue FCF (FD&C Blue 1)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Copper complexes of chlorophylls and chlorophyllins (i) Copper complexes of chlorophylls (ii) Copper complexes of chlorophyllins
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Fast Green FCF (FD&C Green 3)
item.status: Approved in the US. Banned in the EU.

item.name: Plain caramel
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Caustic sulphite caramel
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Ammonia caramel
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Brown FK (kipper brown)
item.status: Approved in the EU for dyeing kippers only, however appears to no longer be used.

item.name: Annatto, bixin, norbixin
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Paprika oleoresin, Capsanthin, capsorubin
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Lycopene
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C 30)
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Canthaxanthin
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Beetroot Red, Betanin
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Anthocyanins
item.purpose: pH dependent(Red, green and purple ranges)

item.name: Titanium dioxide
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US.

item.name: Iron oxides and iron hydroxides
item.status: Approved in the EU. Approved in the US for sausage casings.

item.name: Sodium acetates (i) Sodium acetate (ii) Sodium diacetate (sodium hydrogen acetate)
Ammonium acetate
item.status: Approved in Australia and New Zealand

item.name: Fatty acid esters of ascorbic acid (Ascorbyl palmitate)
Sodium citrates (i) Monosodium citrate (ii) Disodium citrate (iii) Sodium citrate (trisodium citrate)
Potassium citrates (i) Monopotassium citrate (ii) Potassium citrate (tripotassium citrate)
Calcium citrates (i) Monocalcium citrate (ii) Dicalcium citrate (iii) Calcium citrate (tricalcium citrate)
Sodium tartrates (i) Monosodium tartrate (ii), Disodium tartrate
Potassium tartrates (i) Monopotassium tartrate (cream of tartar) (ii) Dipotassium tartrate
Sodium phosphates (i) Monosodium phosphate (ii) Disodium phosphate (iii) Trisodium phosphate
Potassium phosphates (i) Monopotassium phosphate (ii) Dipotassium phosphate (iii) Tripotassium phosphate
Calcium phosphates (i) Monocalcium phosphate (ii) Dicalcium phosphate (iii) Tricalcium phosphate
Ammonium phosphates: (i) monoammonium phosphate (ii) diammonium phosphate
Magnesium phosphates (i) monomagnesium phosphate (ii) Dimagnesium phosphate
item.status: Approved in the EU. This additive is under discussion and may be included in a future amendment to the Directive on miscellaneous additives.

item.name: Sodium malates (i) Sodium malate (ii) Sodium hydrogen malate
Calcium malates (i) Calcium malate (ii) Calcium hydrogen malate
Calcium disodium ethylene diamine tetraacetate, (Calcium disodium EDTA)
Konjac (i) Konjac gum (ii) Konjac glucomannane
item.status: Approved in the EU. May not be used in confectionery owing to choking risk.[citation needed]

item.name: Diphosphates (i) Disodium diphosphate (ii) Trisodium diphosphate (iii) Tetrasodium diphosphate (iv) Dipotassium diphosphate (v) Tetrapotassium diphosphate (vi) Dicalcium diphosphate (vii) Calcium dihydrogen diphosphate
Triphosphates (i) Sodium triphosphate (pentasodium triphosphate) (ii) Pentapotassium triphosphate
Polyphosphates (i) Sodium polyphosphates (ii) Potassium polyphosphates (iii) Sodium calcium polyphosphate (iv) Calcium polyphosphates (v) Ammonium polyphosphate
Crosslinked sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (Croscarmellose)
item.status: Approved in the EU. This additive is under discussion and may be included in a future amendment to the Directive on miscellaneous additives

item.name: Sodium, potassium and calcium salts of fatty acids (emulsifier)
Mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids (glyceryl monostearate, glyceryl distearate)
Acetic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Lactic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Citric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Mono- and diacetyl tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Mixed acetic and tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Propane-1,2-diol esters of fatty acids, propylene glycol esters of fatty acids
Lactylated fatty acid esters of glycerol and propane-1
Thermally oxidized soya bean oil interacted with mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Partial polyglycerol esters of polycondensed fatty acids of castor oil
Sodium carbonates (i) Sodium carbonate (ii) Sodium bicarbonate (Sodium hydrogen carbonate) (iii) Sodium sesquicarbonate (acidity regulator)
Potassium carbonates (i) Potassium carbonate (ii) Potassium bicarbonate (Potassium hydrogen carbonate)
Ammonium carbonates (i) Ammonium carbonate (ii) Ammonium bicarbonate (Ammonium hydrogen carbonate)
Magnesium carbonates (i) Magnesium carbonate (ii) Magnesium bicarbonate Magnesium hydrogen carbonate
Sodium Silicates (i) Sodium silicate (ii) Sodium metasilicate
Montanic acid esters, Montan acid esters
Dichlorodifluoromethane
item.status: Banned in all countries, in compliance with the Montreal Protocol.

item.name: Cyclamic acid and its sodium and calcium salts, also known as Cyclamate
Saccharin and its sodium, potassium and calcium salts
Dextrin (Dextrins, roasted starch white and yellow) (stabiliser)
Distarch phosphate esterified with sodium trimetasphosphate; esterified with phosphorus oxychloride (stabiliser)
Starch acetate esterified with acetic anhydride (stabiliser)
Starch acetate esterified with vinyl acetate (stabiliser)
